messages.content:
You are a debugging assistant. You will be presented with a failing test, and tools (functions) to access the source code of the system under test (SUT). Your task is to provide a step-by-step explanation of how the bug occurred, based on the failing test and the information you retrieved using tests about the SUT. You will be given 9 chances to interact with functions to gather relevant information. An example answer would look like follows.

Title: Diagnosis of test `testGenerateURLFragment`
Details: The test `testGenerateURLFragment` checks whether HTML entities such as `"` are correctly escaped to their corresponding character by the `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` method. However, the test failure indicates that this is not the case. Following the execution path, we find that `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` is not escaping any HTML code; instead, it is using its input `toolTipText` as is. Consequently, un-escaped strings are being returned, which leads to the error demonstrated by the test.

After providing this diagnosis, you will be prompted to suggest which methods would be the best locations to be fixed. The answers should be in the form of `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` without commentary (one per line), as your answer will be automatically processed before finally being presented to the user.

The test `['org.jfree.data.time.junit.TimeSeriesTests.testCreateCopy3()']` failed.
The test looks like:

```java
597 :     public void testCreateCopy3() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
598 :         TimeSeries s1 = new TimeSeries("S1");
599 :         s1.add(new Year(2009), 100.0);
600 :         s1.add(new Year(2010), 101.0);
601 :         s1.add(new Year(2011), 102.0);
604 : 
605 :         TimeSeries s2 = s1.createCopy(0, 1);
607 :         assertEquals(101.0, s2.getMaxY(), EPSILON); // error occurred here
612 :     }
```

It failed with the following error message and call stack:

```
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: expected:<101.0> but was:<102.0>
	at org.jfree.data.time.junit.TimeSeriesTests.testCreateCopy3(TimeSeriesTests.java:607)
seriesA = org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeries@dff4d8cf
seriesB = org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeries@bcfbe6d2
seriesC = org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeries@2a8c55b7
gotSeriesChangeEvent = false
EPSILON = 1.0E-10
class$org$jfree$data$time$junit$TimeSeriesTests = class org.jfree.data.time.junit.TimeSeriesTests
class$org$jfree$data$time$Year = null
s1 = org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeries@1672633f
s2 = org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeries@6df9c28a
```

Start by calling the `get_failing_tests_covered_classes` function.

The failing test `org.jfree.data.time.junit.TimeSeriesTests.testCreateCopy3()` covers classes in the `org.jfree.data.time` package, specifically `TimeSeries`, `TimeSeriesDataItem`, and `Year`. Next, let's see which methods of the `TimeSeries` class are covered by failing tests. Call the `get_failing_tests_covered_methods_for_class` function with the class name `org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeries`.

messages.name: get_failing_tests_covered_methods_for_class
messages.content: [".createCopy(int, int)", ".add(org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeriesDataItem)", ".getMinY()", ".getMaxY()", ".add(org.jfree.data.time.RegularTimePeriod, double)", ".add(org.jfree.data.time.RegularTimePeriod, double, boolean)", ".add(org.jfree.data.time.RegularTimePeriod, java.lang.Number)", ".add(org.jfree.data.time.RegularTimePeriod, java.lang.Number, boolean)", ".getRawDataItem(int)", ".getTimePeriod(int)", ".add(org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeriesDataItem, boolean)", ".removeAgedItems(boolean)", ".minIgnoreNaN(double, double)", ".maxIgnoreNaN(double, double)", ".updateBoundsForAddedItem(org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeriesDataItem)", ".getItemCount()", ".TimeSeries(java.lang.Comparable)", ".TimeSeries(java.lang.Comparable, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)"]

The `TimeSeries` class has several covered methods by failing tests. The method `createCopy(int, int)` is one of them. In the failing test `testCreateCopy3()`, the `createCopy` method is being used to create a copy of a `TimeSeries` with a specified range of items. The assertion that failed checks the maximum Y value of the copied series. The failure indicates that the copied series did not have the expected maximum Y value.

Based on the available information, provide the signatures of the most likely culprit methods for the bug. Your answer will be processed automatically, so make sure to only answer with the accurate signatures of all likely culprits (in `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` format), without commentary (one per line).
